question: Consider the following customers table and the PLSQL code.
query:
DECLARE number_rows number(2);
BEGIN
UPDATE customers SET salary = salary + 500;
IF sql%notfound THEN
dbms_output.put_line(â€˜zero customer records updated');
ELSIF sql%found THEN
number_rows := sql%rowcount;
dbms_output.put_line( number_rows || ' customers updated ');
END IF;
END;?

What will be result of running the PLSQL code?

description.A: sql%notfound return true if the update statement does not change any rows in the table.  Re-think!
description.B: sql%found will  return true if the SQL statement affects  / selects one or more  number of rows  and SQL%rowcount returns the number of rows affected / selected.  Here the update statement affects 4 rows in customer table
description.C: sql%found will have the number of rows affected by the SQL statement.  How can it be one row here?  Re-think!
description.D: It is a valid PL/SQL block without any error!

question: Which of the following are valid attributes of implicit cursor in PL/SQL? Select one or more as applicable.

description.A: Yes, it is a valid attribute of implicit cursor.
description.B: Yes, it is a valid attribute of implicit cursor.
description.C: Yes, it is a valid attribute of implicit cursor.
description.D: Yes, it is a valid attribute of implicit cursor.
